3.19.18  6:39 pm  how do regular major/minor chords such as Cm FM Gm Dm differ from C7m F7M G7m etc?

     
so far I've made it the basics on notes and stuff but I really never grasped on chords since i have very tight schedules and unfortunately had to rest the music department in my life to do other work. actually, three questions, how do you know which notes are #/b when attempting to read music with various time signatures rather than glancing at the keyboard to know what note is which on the scale?

      I'd really appreciate your response

3.19.18  6:26 pm   3.18.18  7:08 pm What does an art theif do with a stolen painting?

     How do you sell a famous painting that's been stolen, without it being obvious that you stole the painting?

      Even if you find an art collector who doesn't care that it's a stolen paining, the collector still can't really put up a famous stolen work of art on display in their home. When the mona lisa was famously missing, it would've looked awfully suspicious if some random person just happened to have it hanging up in their living room or something.

3.19.18  3:17 pm   As much as I love jazz, I have never been able to "acquire" a taste for overly dissonant parts that somehow become recognied by music buffs as genius.

     So I wholeharedtly agree with your approach of focusing on the way music "sounds", but you seem to have an excellent grasp of theory,

      and this is why so many of your fans ask for tips on studying, yet you are often dismissive of such questions.

      I just wanted to let you know that you're a hero among aspiring musicians, and we just want to know if you have any tips on how to learn all the rules, even if it means we have to break them every now and then.
